column4: does anyone know how to use postfix RELOCATED maps maybe. i got some users internal and some on ISP on same domain. so internal can't send to external users
550 users does not exist in virtual mailbox maps....
sounds like your user does not map to the user in the map file
not sure if thats the 550 error user, or a user with a uid of 550
error 550
user does not exist in maps
ok, so look in the map file
thats corrent
map is over ldap
ok, so is the user in the map
user that is not in the map uses ISP mailbox
no
so surly that is the problem....user is not in map, error, user is not in map
user MUST not be in virtual mailbox map
or am I missunderstanding
can transport map do transport for pecific user
if the user is not in the virtual mailbox map, it must have a physical account with a FQDN pointing at it
I don't think you can set a map for a specific user, I'm not %100 though
the guys in #postfix may be %100 certain
guys at #postfix are idleing
give them time, they are good, they do get back to you
will wait
